intro: Sinapis erucoides, commonly known as wild mustard, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops like cabbage and broccoli. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring alternate, pinnately lobed leaves and bright yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its seeds are small, round, and often used in traditional medicine and as a spice. Sinapis erucoides is also a common weed in agricultural fields and disturbed soils.
